intro: Lippia cordifolia, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wetlands and stream banks. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Its ornamental value also makes it a popular choice for garden use.
